Instruction:
Task Description: Create a Java class that implements a TCP client using Netty framework to connect to multiple hosts, send HTTP requests, and handle responses.

Class Description: NettyTcpClient is a TCP client implementation using Netty framework that connects to multiple hosts, sends HTTP GET requests to a specified path, and handles responses. It manages connection lifecycle and includes automatic reconnection on failure.

Attributes:
- hosts: List<String> - List of host addresses to connect to
- port: int - TCP port number for connections
- path: String - HTTP path for GET requests
- group: EventLoopGroup - Netty event loop group for managing I/O threads
- bootstrap: Bootstrap - Netty bootstrap for client configuration
- channelConnectListener: ChannelConnectListener - Listener for connection events

Methods:
- NettyTcpClient(List<String> hosts, int port, String path) -> None - Constructor that initializes the client with target hosts, port, and request path
- connect() -> None - Initiates connections to all specified hosts
- shutdown() -> None - Gracefully shuts down the client and releases resources
- ResponseHandler(Bootstrap bootstrap) -> None - (Inner class constructor) Handles HTTP responses and manages request cycle
- channelActive(ChannelHandlerContext ctx) -> None - (Inner class method) Called when channel becomes active, sends initial request
- channelRead0(ChannelHandlerContext ctx, HttpObject msg) -> None - (Inner class method) Processes incoming HTTP messages
- channelInactive(ChannelHandlerContext ctx) -> None - (Inner class method) Handles channel disconnection and triggers reconnection
- sendRequest(ChannelHandlerContext ctx) -> None - (Inner class method) Sends HTTP GET request
- operationComplete(ChannelFuture future) -> None - (Inner class method) Listener callback for connection completion events
